page.title: 11The Woods
page.content: About 1.5 miles east of{Blackmore there is an area of{woodland}.It is made up of four woods,Parsons Spring, Birch Spring,Barrow Wood and College wood.The woods are seperated by{banks and{ditches},which are several hundred years old.They were originally built to keep deer from wandering out of the woods and had wooden fences on top of the bank.{Coppicing}has been carried out from 1982 to 1985.The coppiced wood is sent to Bowater to be used for making paper.The{ecology}is varied. There are Oak,Sweet Chestnut, Hornbeam and Silver Birch.There are 2 species of deer.Three herds of Fallow deer and one herd of Monk Back deer,squirrels, badgers,foxes,rabbits, kingfishers and nightingales.The woods are ideal for {recreation}such as horseriding and rambling.
